kszucs commented on issue #4384: ARROW-4302: [C++] Add OpenSSL to C++ build toolchain
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4384#issuecomment-496933925
 
 
   There are multiple places this change should have been incorporated in: 
   - explicit conda dependencies in CI (rather than depending on openssl as a transitive dependency)
   - packaging tasks: wheels, conda, linux (most of them are failing now)
   - integration / docker-compose tests
   
   Sadly We don't have instant feedback from these builds, so We should be a bit more careful with introducing new (default) dependencies. 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

   @kszucs Apologies for breaking those. Can you help with making the changes needed there? Alternatively, we can disable the support by setting `PARQUET_BUILD_ENCRYPTION` to `OFF` by default.

kszucs commented on issue #4384: ARROW-4302: [C++] Add OpenSSL to C++ build toolchain
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4384#issuecomment-496963162
 
 
   @majetideepak it is not anyone's fault, currently We only get notified after merging to master, which is the root cause - the tooling still needs a lot of development to provide quick and more visible feedback.
   
   Certainly your proposal would be the best and incrementally opt-in for `PARQUET_BUILD_ENCRYPTION` in the packaging builds.

kszucs commented on issue #4384: ARROW-4302: [C++] Add OpenSSL to C++ build toolchain
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4384#issuecomment-497293889
 
 
   @wesm that depends on how We want to run the packaging tasks:
   - via ursabot, but We doesn't have windows or mac workers yet - requires to reimplement the packaging tasks
   - via crossbow (triggered by ursabot) which requires additional scheduling logic to notify ursabot about the finished crossbow tasks (additionally crossbow must be installable to host alongside ursabot's buildmaster)

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

fields.description: This is needed for encryption support for Parquet, among other things.
fields.summary: [C++] Add OpenSSL to C++ build toolchain

comments.body: Hmm... Parquet grew encryption support? I'm a bit worried here.

Yes, the design for this has been ongoing on the Parquet mailing list over the last year. Parquet files have become one of the world's most important open source data warehousing formats; having column-level encryption was an inevitable requirement.

Thank you [~wesmckinn] for creating this task. I'm developing the parquet encryption module in C++, but lack of Cmake experience. I will appreciate if someone can help me add OpenSSL as Cmake flexible module, just like boost or other third-party modules of parquet. Thanks!

[~thamha], [~James C] and I can help with the OpenSSL part. We have some experience with this from the Libhdfs++ project. Do you want to share your code first in a PR? We can then add support for OpenSSL.
Great you can help. This is my PR for encryption module, still in update: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2555
There is code in gRPC for OpenSSL you can look at
